tortoises mostly eat grass and weeds, plants that would not be very nutritious to humans, like dandelions or clover. if you are unsure if a tortoise can eat a certain plant, you can always ask me
taking care of a tortoise includes feeding it every day and keeping its enclosure clean, and bathing it once a week. i can give you the details for both the daily routine and how to bathe a tortoise
try to fill the food bowl to the brim, but without squishing down the food. you can see the following day how much of the food was left and adjust accordingly

the substrate in the enclosure needs to be changed every three months, so you probably do not have to do it while you're in charge of taking care of the tortoise. if you do, please contact its owner for more instructions
the tortoise should be bathed on saturday
the round lamp is the heat lamp, and the long lamp is the UVB lamp

tortoises are cold-blooded animals, which means their activity levels depend on the temperature. if it is hot and sunny, they will walk around a lot, if it's colder, they will prefer to bask and sleep under the heat lamp
you shouldn't hold a tortoise unless you're moving it to its bath or its carrier; if you do, make sure to hold it gently but firmly around the shell, ideally providing some support for the legs

on mondays you should feed the tortoise and remember to add some calcium powder to the food
today you should just feed the tortoise and add some pellets to its food
